title: Conflicting aims in electricity privatisation
abstract: Electricity supply in the UK provides an example of the conflicts governments face in privatizations, between raising maximum revenue and ensuring satisfactory industrial structure and behaviour. The discussion involves modern share valuation theory as well as the particular problem of the nuclear sector
publisher: Chartered Institute of Public Finance & Accountancy
